recipes.title: Chicken Curry

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: In a pot over medium heat, heat about 1-inch oil. Add potatoes and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes or until lightly browned and tender. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Add carrots and cook for about 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.Remove oil from pot, leaving about 1 tablespoon. Add onions and garlic and cook until limp and aromatic. Add chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 7 to 8 minutes or until chicken changes color and juices run clear. Add fish sauce and continue to cook for about 2 to 3 minutes.Add coconut milk and ater. Bring to a boil, skimming scum that may rise to top. Lower heat, cover and continue to cook for about 25 to 30 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked. Add potatoes and carrots and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes or until fork-tender. Add curry powder and cook, stirring to combine, for about 3 to 5 minutes or until sauce starts to thicken. Season with salt to taste. Add bell peppers and cook for about 1 minute or until tender yet crisp. Serve hot.

steps.step: In a pot over medium heat, heat about 1-inch oil.
Add potatoes and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes or until lightly browned and tender.
Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.
Add carrots and cook for about 1 to 2 minutes.
Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.
Remove oil from pot, leaving about 1 tablespoon.
Add onions and garlic and cook until limp and aromatic.
Add chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 7 to 8 minutes or until chicken changes color and juices run clear.
Add fish sauce and continue to cook for about 2 to 3 minutes.
Add coconut milk and ater. Bring to a boil, skimming scum that may rise to top. Lower heat, cover and continue to cook for about 25 to 30 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked.
Add potatoes and carrots and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes or until fork-tender.
Add curry powder and cook, stirring to combine, for about 3 to 5 minutes or until sauce starts to thicken. Season with salt to taste.
Add bell peppers and cook for about 1 minute or until tender yet crisp.
